thread.title: Manchester United will have to pay £50m to sign Benfica’s Victor Lindelof this summer
thread.title_full: Manchester United will have to pay £50m to sign Benfica’s Victor Lindelof this summer

author: smorgan
title: Manchester United will have to pay £50m to sign Benfica’s Victor Lindelof this summer
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments MANCHESTER UNITED manager Jose Mourinho will have to fork out £50m if he wants to land Benfica man Victor Lindelof this summer. 
The Red Devils were tipped to sign the Benfica centre-back during the January transfer window, but Mourinho opted against the move. Reuters Jose Mourinho opted against a January move for Victor Lindelof but a summer transfer will cost even more AP:Associated Press 2 Lindelof has impressed with his displays for Portuguese giants Benfica this season 
That decision could come back to haunt United, with Lindelof’s asking price rising from £34.5m to £50m after Benfica inserted a release clause into his contract, according to the Daily Express . 
The 22 year-old’s impressive displays this season have seen his value continue to increase, with the Portuguese giants ready to cash in. RELATED ARTICLES Manchester United could resurrect Victor Lindelof deal after Benfica remove trouble clause NICK VIC Chelsea plan hijack of £38m Manchester United target Victor Lindelof as Benfica seek bidding war Thinking ahead Jose Mourinho reveals he already knows who he wants to sign in the summer transfer window Lindel-off? Man United 'to make decision this week on whether to sign Benfica's Victor Lindelof this month or in summer' Brave Mou World Jose Mourinho reveals his summer transfer list is COMPLETE as he eyes £80m Griezmann Jose Mourinho answers a journalist's phone during press conference 
Mourinho is known to be a big admirer of the Sweden international and made him one of his top transfer targets during the January window. 
But the Portuguese boss decided to stick with his current centre-back pairing of Phil Jones and Marcos Rojo, with United unbeaten in the Premier League since October.
